alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:01PM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lower Keys in Monroe County through 830 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from near Big Pine Key to near Middle Torch Key. Movement was southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Niles Channel Bridge, Saddlebunch Keys, Little Torch Key, Upper Sugarloaf Key, Middle Torch Key, Little Palm Island Resort, Bay Point, Big Torch Key, Summerland Key and Big Pine Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 13 and 32. This includes US 1 between mile markers 13 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
